page.title: 01General Review
page.content: This area on the eastern foothills of the Pennine Chain lies midway between the River Tees and the River Greta.Formerly in the North Riding of Yorkshire,it became in 1974 part of the{District of Teesdale}in the{County {of Durham.} With the exception of Boldron Village which contains church,chapel,village hall and public house,it is a sparsely populated area largely taken up by a number of small farms and a few acres of derelict land. Apart from a brick works,a family plant-hire firm and a small quarry,the area contains no industry.The improved A66 trunk road runs through the area, but,otherwise,the abandoned railway cutting,the small,redundant reservoir and numerous disused quarries paint a rather sad picture of what used to be.
